dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Nearly 164 billion dollars. That's the combined net worth of the six Walton family members as of Thursday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nearly one hundred sixty four billion dollars. That's the combined net worth of the six Walton family members as of Thursday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that actually puts them neck and neck with Jeff Bezos, who was at 165.8 billion that same afternoon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that actually puts them neck and neck with Jeff Bezos, who was at one hundred sixty five point eight billion that same afternoon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—even with Amazon's stock surge, the Waltons are still right there, thanks partly to Walmart's own stock jumping almost 5% after their earnings report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-even with Amazon's stock surge, the Waltons are still right there, thanks partly to Walmart's own stock jumping almost five percent after their earnings report.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that jump added like, what, 10 billion dollars to the family fortune in just one day?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that jump added like, what, ten billion dollars to the family fortune in just one day?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, with 47 billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, with forty seven billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And her brothers Jim and Rob are each worth around 48 billion too—all in the top twenty nationwide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And her brothers Jim and Rob are each worth around forty eight billion too-all in the top twenty nationwide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting how Walmart is really pushing back against Amazon though, especially with things like grocery delivery expansion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting how Walmart is really pushing back against Amazon though, especially with things like grocery delivery expansion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, they mentioned their online catalog growth and even pointed out a rapid decrease in their shoe business, which is a direct battleground with Amazon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, they mentioned their online catalog growth and even pointed out a rapid decrease in their shoe business, which is a direct battleground with Amazon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Especially since Amazon bought Whole Foods to compete in groceries too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially since Amazon bought Whole Foods to compete in groceries too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now they're aiming for grocery delivery in 30% of the U.S. by year-end—that's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now they're aiming for grocery delivery in thirty percent of the U.S. by year-end-that's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: If they keep this up, the article says the Waltons could become the first 190 billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If they keep this up, the article says the Waltons could become the first one hundred ninety billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just… mind-boggling, honestly. The scale of wealth here is almost hard to comprehend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... mind-boggling, honestly. The scale of wealth here is almost hard to comprehend.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It shows how dominant these retail giants still are, even with all the e-commerce shifts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It shows how dominant these retail giants still are, even with all the e-commerce shifts.

artist_script:
HostA: Nearly 164 billion dollars. That's the combined net worth of the six Walton family members as of Thursday.
HostB: Yeah, and that actually puts them neck and neck with Jeff Bezos, who was at 165.8 billion that same afternoon.
HostA: It's wild—even with Amazon's stock surge, the Waltons are still right there, thanks partly to Walmart's own stock jumping almost 5% after their earnings report.
HostB: And that jump added like, what, 10 billion dollars to the family fortune in just one day?
HostA: Exactly. And it pushed Alice Walton back to being the world's richest woman, with 47 billion dollars.
HostB: Oh wow, so she overtook Francoise Bettencourt Meyers from L'Oreal again.
HostA: Yep. And her brothers Jim and Rob are each worth around 48 billion too—all in the top twenty nationwide.
HostB: It's interesting how Walmart is really pushing back against Amazon though, especially with things like grocery delivery expansion.
HostA: Right, they mentioned their online catalog growth and even pointed out a rapid decrease in their shoe business, which is a direct battleground with Amazon.
HostB: Especially since Amazon bought Whole Foods to compete in groceries too.
HostA: Yeah, and now they're aiming for grocery delivery in 30% of the U.S. by year-end—that's huge.
HostB: If they keep this up, the article says the Waltons could become the first 190 billion dollar family in history.
HostA: Which is just… mind-boggling, honestly. The scale of wealth here is almost hard to comprehend.
HostB: Absolutely. It shows how dominant these retail giants still are, even with all the e-commerce shifts.
